designScenario.name: S A T C O M Module
designScenario.description: The S A T C O M Module is an advanced avionics subsystem designed to provide high-throughput, low-latency satellite communication for modern aircraft. It ensures reliable data exchange for real-time flight operations, passenger connectivity, and mission-critical telemetry. The module incorporates adaptive beamforming, multi-band operation, and enhanced cybersecurity to meet the evolving demands of global air traffic and digital cockpits.

details.description: Support automatic beamforming to optimize signal strength under varying flight conditions.
Enable simultaneous operation across Ku- and Ka-band frequencies for global coverage flexibility.
Achieve peak data rates of up to 150 Mbps for passenger internet services.
Maintain latency below 150ms for cockpit-to-ground command transmission.
Implement triple-redundant signal processing units to ensure uninterrupted communication during single-point failures.
Provide fail-safe mode that automatically switches to backup transponder within 200ms of primary failure detection.
Adopt a plug-and-play design allowing rapid integration of future encryption protocols (e.g., post-quantum cryptography).
Comply with RTCA DO-326A cybersecurity standards for aviation communication systems.

systemComponents.name: S A T C O M Module
systemComponents.description: Centralized satellite communication subsystem managing end-to-end data transmission with ground stations and aircraft systems.

subComponents.name: Adaptive Beamforming Antenna
subComponents.description: Phased array antenna system capable of dynamic beam steering and null steering to mitigate interference.

subComponents.name: Multi-Band Transceiver
subComponents.description: Dual-frequency transceiver supporting Ku- and Ka-band operation with automatic frequency selection.

subComponents.name: Cybersecurity Processor
subComponents.description: Dedicated hardware module for real-time encryption/decryption and intrusion detection.

subComponents.name: Avionics Data Gateway
subComponents.description: Protocol converter enabling seamless data exchange between satellite formats and ARINC 429/664 avionics buses.

relationships.source: S A T C O M Module
relationships.description: The antenna array is physically integrated as part of the main module's hardware assembly.

relationships.source: S A T C O M Module
relationships.description: The transceiver unit is a core component responsible for RF signal processing.

relationships.target: S A T C O M Module
relationships.description: The security processor is logically associated with all communication streams processed by the module.
The gateway depends on the central processor for flight data acquisition and command distribution.

attributes.name: operatingFrequency
attributes.description: Dual-frequency operation for global satellite network compatibility.

attributes.name: dataRate
attributes.description: Differentiated bandwidth allocation for mission-critical vs passenger services.

attributes.name: redundancy
attributes.description: Three independent processing units for fault-tolerant operation.

attributes.name: encryptionProtocol
attributes.description: Hybrid encryption system combining classical and quantum-resistant algorithms.

attributes.name: latency
attributes.description: Differentiated latency requirements for critical vs non-critical data.

attributes.name: beamformingCapability
attributes.description: Number of antenna elements enabling advanced beamforming capabilities.

attributes.name: powerConsumption
attributes.description: Power requirements under operational load conditions.

comments.body: This block represents the primary satellite communication system for aircraft data link communications.
